docs.title: Welcome to the Gorilla Tag modding guide
Table of contents
docs.text:
• Getting Started
  • Choosing your platform
    • Windows
    • Linux
  • The end(already??)

extras: - Locating your game path

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
PR's are encouraged!

NOTICE:

docs.title: Quest mods are not supported!
docs.text:
There are no legit or safe quest mods available for Gorilla Tag. Anyone providing one is likely providing a Virus/malware so DO NOT USE THEM!

While Quest mods do exist they are extremely likely to be a virus or malware and will almost certainly get you banned from the game if used. Please do not trust any quest mod!

docs.title: Choosing Your Platform
docs.text: Before installing mods, you need to choose the platform you will be running Gorilla Tag on. Currently, as mentioned before, modding is only supported on PCVR.

docs.title: Platforms
docs.text:
• Windows The most supported platform with the easiest setup and compatibility with BepInEx mods.

  • Linux Supported via Steam and Proton. Setup may require additional configuration, but most mods can run if requirements are met.

docs.title: For Steam:
docs.text:
1. Open your Steam library and right click Gorilla Tag > Manage > Browse Local Files

  2. A folder should open. To get its path:

  3. Click the top bar and copy the path (Ctrl + C).

  4. Back in Monke Mod Manager, click Browse in the game path selector.

  5. Your file manager will open. Navigate to the Gorilla Tag folder as above.

  6. Click the address bar, paste the path, and press Enter.

  7. In Monke Mod Manager, click OK to confirm your game path.

That's it!

< Prev page

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
To get started with Gorilla Tag modding, you only need:

  • PCVR Gorilla Tag You can purchase it from:
  • Steam (recommended)
  • Meta PC app

The game costs $20.

next page

docs.title: Linux
docs.text: When modding Gorilla Tag on Linux, you have two main options:

docs.title: Difficulty: Easy
docs.text: MMM is the simplest way to install mods.

docs.title: Step 1: Download
docs.text: Download Monke Mod Manager

docs.title: Step 2: Launch MMM
docs.text:
It should look omething like this:

  • Click OK and enter your Gorilla Tag game path.
  • Don’t know your game path? Click here for a guide

docs.title: Step 3: Install Mods
docs.text:
• Click Install next to the mods you want.
  • MMM handles the rest — very straightforward and super easy

docs.title: Step 4: Set Launch Options (Steam)
docs.text:
• In your Steam library, right-click Gorilla Tag > Properties > Launch Options and paste:
WINEDLLOVERRIDES="winhttp=n,b" %command%

- Close the window.

docs.title: Step 5: Installing Custom Mods (Optional)
docs.text:
Mods not included in MMM can be installed manually:

  1. Grab the mod .dll file.
  2. Move it to your plugins folder at: (your game path)\BepInEx\plugins

docs.title: Difficulty: Medium
docs.text: This option requires more steps, its good if you want to learn I guess

docs.title: Step 1: Download BepInEx
docs.text:
Get the latest BepInEx_win_x64_*.zip from BepInEx Releases

Yes, even on linux, we still download the windows version

docs.title: Step 2: Extract
docs.text:
• Extract the zip contents into your Gorilla Tag game path.
  • Your folder should now contain BepInEx, doorstop_config.ini, etc.

docs.title: Step 3: Configure & Install Mods
docs.text:
1. Fixing Config
  2. Download this BepInEx config file
  3. Move it to: (your game path)\BepInEx\config

  4. Create the config folder if it doesn’t exist.

  5. Installing Mods

  6. Grab the mod .dll file.
  7. Move it to your plugins folder at: (your game path)\BepInEx\plugins
  8. Create the plugins folder if it doesn’t exist.

docs.title: Step 4: Set Launch Options (Steam)
docs.text:
• In your Steam library, right-click Gorilla Tag > Properties > Launch Options and paste:
WINEDLLOVERRIDES="winhttp=n,b" %command%

- Close the window.

next page >

docs.title: Thanks for reading!
docs.text: If you need more help or want to join the community, check out the modding Discord: https://discord.gg/monkemod

docs.title: Windows
docs.text: When modding Gorilla Tag on Windows, you have two main options:

docs.title: Difficulty: Easy
docs.text: MMM is the simplest way to install mods.

docs.title: Step 1: Download
docs.text: Download Monke Mod Manager

docs.title: Step 2: Launch MMM
docs.text:
It should look omething like this:

  • Click OK and enter your Gorilla Tag game path.
  • Don’t know your game path? Click here for a guide

docs.title: Step 3: Install Mods
docs.text:
• Click Install next to the mods you want.
  • MMM handles the rest — very straightforward and super easy

docs.title: Step 4: Installing Custom Mods
docs.text:
Mods not included in MMM can be installed manually:

  1. Grab the mod .dll file.
  2. Move it to your plugins folder at: (your game path)\BepInEx\plugins

docs.title: Difficulty: Medium
docs.text: This option requires more steps, its good if you want to learn or your AV is flagging mmm

docs.title: Step 1: Download BepInEx
docs.text: Get the latest BepInEx_win_x64_*.zip from BepInEx Releases

docs.title: Step 2: Extract
docs.text:
• Extract the zip contents into your Gorilla Tag game path.
  • Your folder should now contain BepInEx, doorstop_config.ini, etc.

docs.title: Step 3: Configure & Install Mods
docs.text:
1. Fixing Config
  2. Download this BepInEx config file
  3. Move it to: (your game path)\BepInEx\config

  4. Create the config folder if it doesn’t exist.

  5. Installing Mods

  6. Grab the mod .dll file.
  7. Move it to your plugins folder at: (your game path)\BepInEx\plugins
  8. Create the plugins folder if it doesn’t exist.
